org.kiji.schema.layout.impl
Class TableLayoutMonitor

java.lang.Object
  org.kiji.schema.layout.impl.TableLayoutMonitor
All Implemented Interfaces:
AutoReferenceCounted
@ApiAudience.Private
public final class TableLayoutMonitor
extends Object
implements AutoReferenceCounted

TableLayoutMonitor provides three services for users of table layouts: 1) it acts as a KijiTableLayout cache which is automatically refreshed when the table layout is updated. 2) it allows LayoutConsumer instances to register to receive a callback when the table layout changes. 3) it registers as a table user in ZooKeeper, and keeps that registration up-to-date with the oldest version of table layout being used by registered LayoutConsumers. This class is thread-safe with the following caveat: * LayoutConsumer instances who register to receive callbacks *must* keep a strong reference to this TableLayoutMonitor for as long as the registration should remain active. This is either for the life of the layout consumer if it is never unregistered, or until unregisterLayoutConsumer(LayoutConsumer) is called.

registerLayoutConsumer

public void registerLayoutConsumer(LayoutConsumer consumer)
                            throws IOException
Register a LayoutConsumer to receive a callback when this table's layout is updated. The caller *must* hold a strong reference to this TableLayoutMonitor instance until either: 1) the caller unregisters itself using unregisterLayoutConsumer(LayoutConsumer). 2) the caller is garbage collected. Registering as a layout consumer is not guaranteed to keep an object from being garbage collected. The consumer will immediately be notified of the current layout before returning.

Parameters:
consumer - to notify when the table's layout is updated.
Throws:
IOException - if the consumer's #update method throws IOException.

unregisterLayoutConsumer

public void unregisterLayoutConsumer(LayoutConsumer consumer)
Unregister a LayoutConsumer. This is not necessary in cases where a consumer wants to continue to receive updates until it is garbage collected. See the class comment and the registerLayoutConsumer(LayoutConsumer) comment for how to properly register as a consumer in this case.

Parameters:
consumer - to unregister.

getLayoutConsumers

public Set<LayoutConsumer> getLayoutConsumers()

Get the set of registered layout consumers. All layout consumers should be updated using LayoutConsumer.update(org.kiji.schema.layout.impl.LayoutCapsule) before this table reports that it has successfully update its layout.

This method is for testing purposes only. It should not be used externally.

Returns:
the set of registered layout consumers.

updateLayoutConsumers

public void updateLayoutConsumers(KijiTableLayout layout)
                           throws IOException
Update all registered LayoutConsumers with a new KijiTableLayout. This method is for testing purposes only. It should not be used externally.

Parameters:
layout - the new KijiTableLayout with which to update consumers.
Throws:
IOException - in case of an error updating LayoutConsumers.
